[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: write()] [Node cache] Can write() on versioned node cache cause cache invalidation race where validators see different cache states, leading to non-deterministic query results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: write()] [State kv store] Can write() to state key-value store violate isolation if concurrent reads see partial writes, breaking the assumption that state transitions are atomic? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: read()] [Restore operation] During state restore requiring coordinated read/write operations, can incorrect lock ordering cause restore to use inconsistent state snapshots, corrupting restored database? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: write()] [Checkpoint creation] Can write() during checkpoint creation be interrupted by panic, leaving checkpoint in incomplete state that appears valid but is missing critical data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: read()] [Mempool ranking] When read() accesses mempool priority ranking during transaction selection, can lock contention delay selection beyond block proposal deadline, causing empty blocks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: write()] [Transaction insertion] Can write() during mempool transaction insertion be exploited by flooding low-priority transactions, causing write contention that prevents high-priority transaction insertion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: read()] [Peer state] When read() accesses peer monitoring state for connectivity decisions, can stale reads cause validators to disconnect from live peers or maintain connections to dead peers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: write()] [Network config] Can write() on network configuration during runtime reconfiguration cause network partitions if writes are applied non-atomically across connection managers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: read()] [Health check] When read() accesses health checker interface state, can lock contention cause health checks to timeout, triggering false positive peer disconnections affecting network topology? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: write()] [Validator set update] Can write() during validator set update in mempool cause some validators to broadcast to old validator set while others use new set, partitioning transaction propagation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: read()] [Network message] When read() accesses network message queue, can lock being held during message deserialization create DoS vector if malicious messages cause prolonged parsing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: write()] [Peer discovery] Can write() on peer discovery state be exploited by eclipse attack where attacker controls lock timing to prevent discovery of honest validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-infallible/src/rwlock.rs] [Function: write()] [Broadcast routing] Can write() on broadcast routing tables during network churn cause inconsistent routing state where some nodes have updated routes while others don't, fragmenting message delivery? (Medium)
